Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2014 08:40AM muzakmom1 wrote: Managed to go tow work without my computer today...The amazing downside to being horrible distracted.  Is it unreasonable for me to expect to hear SOMETHING from my doctor one way or the other before my postop appointment?  I'm more anxious of the next set of waiting than the biopsy. And why do they keep calling it surgery if it is a biopsy?   Thankful that in a few days we will have the distraction of my daughters dance competition at Myrtle Beach. Quality time with the kids and our dance family is always great!!!
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy and results muzakmom1 muzakmom1

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2014 08:38PM muzakmom1 wrote: Got a call from the doctors office today, unfortunately they were calling to check on my recovery. I asked again for my results by phone but she said they only discuss at scheduled postop and the BS is out of the office next week. So, I'll wait. Meanwhile...Our air conditioner decided to stop working tonight.... it's going to be a long night.
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy and results muzakmom1 muzakmom1

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2014 05:03AM muzakmom1 wrote: Two more days and I have my preop appointment. My son was home this weekend and the last thing he said to me...Mom stop worrying...you are going to be fine either way!  Of course I cried, but the support of my family and friends keeps me sane!  My goal today is to be productive at work and focus on the tasks at hand.  One step, one day...at a time.. Thankful I found this site and while I don't know all your names, the women of the BCO have been added to my prayer list.   Thanks for listening.
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy and results muzakmom1 muzakmom1

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2014 03:55AM muzakmom1 wrote: yesterday started off with a trip to the breast clinic for ductogram and me the line blue dye injection.  After 2 hours and two different doctors, I finally asked them to stop and call the doctor for plan B. Apparently, the first doctor was really lucky on 6/19 to isolate the duct.   My surgeon was comfortable doing the surgery with the dye, using films from previous ductogram.  Surgery went well, doctor informed my husband that everything looked normal around excision so he was hopeful that pathology report would come back clear. Observations... The hospital staff was great and moved quickly to try to keep me on schedule...even though the ductogram had me an hour late.  My anesthesiologist provided clear expectations and made sure I was given anti - nausea medicines during and after surgery. I woke up with chills and hyper sensitive to anything touching my breast.  Felt like I was being slashed by the wolverine.  That sensation finally went away about midnight.  Just used saran wrap to cover breast and was able to bathe this morning.  Just took my meds (doctor recommended taking full dosages through today and tapering off tomorrow). Sleeping in my recliner was a great idea, but hard to get good rest once the family is awake.  Waiting on post op to get results. However surgeon told my husband to call for an appointment next week which is much sooner than scheduled appointment.  So I'll wait optimistically and wait for results.
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy and results muzakmom1 muzakmom1

Posts.Content: muzakmom1 wrote: I started my initial post in worried but not diagnosed..I still have no diagnosis and anxiously waiting for an excisional biopsy of a milk duct in my right breast (microdochectomy)  the surgery is scheduled outpatient on the 16th, but was told by the scheduler the doctor would review pathology on the 29th.  That is 13 days (almost) 2 weeks to wait. I've been having tests and appointments I'm since April 14th. My faith, sanity and patience is running out and I'm extremely anxious to remove whatever they saw and make sure it's clear.  I've been told by Radiologist who did the ductogram that it's 80/20 for not cancer and BS said 85/15...those odds are very fsvorabke...but waiting since April 23rd for definitive answers is driving en crazy. Everyone is telling me I'll be fine and I just don't believe them.  Adding to insult...my uncle is within his last days of life (kidney cancer) and my best work friend has just been referred to Hospice for end of life care (analysis and liver cancer) .   I'm finding it hard to be optimistic when all the things I told them now seem to be end of road... Should I go see my PCP and discuss anxiety?  Let go...Let God! Surgery 8/5/2014 Lumpectomy: Right Dx 8/14/2014, DCIS, 4cm, Stage 0, Grade 2, ER+/PR+ Dx 9/3/2014, DCIS, Right, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 9/25/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy and results muzakmom1 muzakmom1

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2014 07:33PM muzakmom1 wrote: I used ice packs every 20 minutes on the day of excision. Today...i pulled back on my meds and feel really sore now.  Based on everyone else's responses they were fine on day 2.  I normally have a pretty high tolerance for pain. No obvious bruising or swelling, but really sore when I extend right hand or lift anything I get a shooting pain.  Is this normal.
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy and results muzakmom1 muzakmom1

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2014 07:47AM muzakmom1 wrote: I loss my friend Debbie at 3:40 am after a 27 month fight of anal and liver cancer. My heart is broken and although I know she was suffering tremendously, I just wish I could kiss her goodbye one more time.  Heading to work to try to comfort our staff as we deal with this loss together. One more day...
Posts.Title: 2 more days muzakmom1 muzakmom1

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2014 12:07PM muzakmom1 wrote: Met with the surgeon today. The papilloma was benign. However, I have atypical ductal hyperplasia. So I have to have another excision to get wider margins and I'm being referred to an oncologist.  Tell me what to do or ask next.
Posts.Title: 2 more days muzakmom1 muzakmom1

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2014 07:08PM muzakmom1 wrote: Thanks for your condolences. I feel like I just have to get good news tomorrow. Surely...i can't lose a friend and get a diagnosis in the span of 48 hours. I just wished I had my results so I could have assured her that I was going to be ok.  This blog...website...circle of women or whatever is most appropriate had given me so much more comfort than anyone else. Nobody understands they emotional turmoil associates with a 80/20. I have felt accepted for saying that this isn't a math quiz and those numbers still scare me.  I'll post my results tomorrow and if I get an all clear...you may hear me praising God through the blog.  Emotionally drained...
Posts.Title: 2 more days muzakmom1 muzakmom1

Posts.Content: muzakmom1 wrote: What seemed like an eternity is almost here. Meet with the surgeon on Tuesday at 8:45 for my results. Do many things are going on that I hardly have time to focus on me.  My friend was transported to Hospice last week and has become totally unresponsive over the weekend. Helping her husband prepare for her cremation, ceremony and reception is overwhelming. Sitting watching her lay in the bed wasting away scared the heck out of me and I find myself selfishly praying "Don't let that be me! "  Share a prayer for her family.  Let go...Let God!
